intro: Cistus corymbosus, commonly known as the woolly cistus, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its grayish-green, fuzzy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant is part of the rockrose family (Cistaceae) and is well adapted to dry, rocky environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cistus corymbosus is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
